'Edouard Louis Joseph, Baron Merckx' () (born 17 June 1945 in Meensel-
Kiezegem [http://www.lequipe.fr/Cyclisme/CyclismeFicheCoureur1989.html
L'Equipe, Rider database, Eddie Merckx] ), better known as 'Eddy Merckx',
is a former Belgian professional road bicycle racer, considered to be the
greatest pro-cyclist ever.

The French magazine VÃ©lo described Merckx as "the most accomplished rider that
cycling has ever known," VÃ©lo, France,
November 2000 while VeloNews of the United States declared him to be the
greatest and most successful cyclist of all time. {{cite web
| title = Happy Birthday, Eddy! author=Velonews.com date = 17 June 2005 url =
| http://velonews.com/article/8224 accessdate =13 June 2008 }}

Merckx, who turned professional in 1965, won the Tour de France and the Giro
d'Italia five times each, and the Vuelta a EspaÃ±a once. He also won all of
professional cycling's classic "monument" races at least twice each (with 19
Classics victories in all). Merckx was
World Champion once as an amateur and three times as a professional, and he even
broke the world hour record before retiring in 1978.

Since then, Merckx has remained active in professional cycling through various
commercial and sporting projects, most notably by manufacturing and selling his
own line of bicycles, Eddy Merckx Cycles. Friebe, Daniel. ''Eddy Merckx, The
Cannibal (2012). ISBN 978-0-09-194316-5. Ebury Press, United Kingdom
categories: Belgian Tour de France stage winners
Belgian Vuelta a España stage winners
headings: Grand Tours and World Championship Placements
